revised_title: Conduction of Heat through Rarefied Gases: A Study of Thermal Conductivity in Low-Pressure Gases
tldr: The authors investigate the conduction of heat through rarefied gases at low pressures, finding that the heat-transmitting power of the gas varies directly as the pressure. They also discover that at these low pressures, gases like methane, acetylene, and cyanogen are slightly better conductors than hydrogen, while helium is only slightly superior to carbon dioxide.
